_header: His brother Ruffyn of him great marvel had
Note: Only fragments of the first leaf are preserved: the first complete line is line 70.
_description: Legend of SS. Wulfhade and Ruffyn

BLCottNeroCXII.First Lines:
His Brothere Ruffin of hym greate marvell hadeAnd as he wente hym
                    for to seeke…
BLCottNeroCXII.Last Lines:
…And all that on this Tabull redes god grante them hys
                    gr…Throue the meyne of these marters in heven to haye a
                    pla…
BLCottNeroCXII.Note:
Manuscript is badly damaged. Only fragments of the first leaf are
                    preserved: the first complete line is line 70.
BLCottNeroCXII.Attributed Title:
The Legend of St Wolfade and Ruffyn Sons to Wolfere King of Mercia,
                    martyred by the Fayth of Crist in memorie of whom the Monsterye of Stone in the
                    County of Stafford was first founded (f. 182)
BLCottNeroCXII.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 308-14.
